articles.author: Dave Graham, Tom Balmforth
articles.description: World leaders will join Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskiy at a summit this weekend to explore ways of ending the deadliest conflict in Europe since World War Two, but Russia isn't invited and the event will fall short of Kyiv's aim of isolating Moscow.
articles.title: Ukraine summit attracts world leaders but fails to isolate Russia

articles.author: Angelo Amante, Crispian Balmer
articles.description: Group of Seven (G7) leaders hold a final day of talks at their annual summit on Friday, with China topping the agenda before Pope Francis puts in a historic appearance to discuss artificial intelligence (AI).
articles.title: China to dominate final day of G7, Pope to lead AI discussions

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli tanks advanced deeper into the western area of Rafah, amid one of the worst nights of bombardment from air, ground, and sea, forcing many families to flee their homes and tents under darkness, residents said on Thursday.
articles.title: Israeli forces thrust deeper into Rafah as diplomacy falters

articles.author: Andrea Shalal
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden and Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskiy signed a 10-year bilateral security agreement on Thursday aimed at bolstering Ukraine's defense against Russian invaders.
articles.title: US, Ukraine ink 10-year defense agreement billed as NATO precursor

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Senior officials of South Korea and the United States held an emergency phone call over a possible impending visit by Russian President Vladimir Putin to North Korea, Seoul's foreign ministry said on Friday.
articles.title: South Korea, US warn against North Korea-Russia military ties ahead of Putin visit

articles.author: Shivangi Acharya, Krishn Kaushik
articles.description: A seminal moment in Prime Minister Narendra Modi's unsuccessful campaign to retain his parliamentary majority occurred days before India's marathon election began in April.
articles.title: India’s opposition leveraged caste and constitution to shock Modi in election

articles.author: David Kirton, Laurie Chen
articles.description: Leading Chinese #MeToo activist Huang Xueqin and a fellow rights campaigner are expected to be found guilty of subversion and sentenced on Friday at a court in southern China, according to a group campaigning for their release.
articles.title: China #MeToo activist Huang expected to be sentenced for subversion on Friday, supporters say

articles.author: Lucy Craymer
articles.description: The New Zealand government said on Friday it would reform the country's "outdated and complicated" firearm laws which have been in place for more than 40 years.
articles.title: New Zealand to reform 'outdated' firearm laws

articles.author: Hyunjoo Jin, Abinaya V, Greg Roumeliotis
articles.description: Tesla shareholders are voting to approve a $56 billion pay package for Elon Musk and to move the electric vehicle maker's legal home to Texas, the CEO said on social media on Wednesday, adding that passage was by wide margins.
articles.title: Musk says Tesla shareholders voting yes for his $56 billion pay package

articles.author: Alasdair Pal
articles.description: Chinese Premier Li Qiang will meet New Zealand business leaders on Friday on the second day of a regional tour that also takes in neighbouring Australia and signals a warming in ties between the Pacific nations and their biggest trading partner.
articles.title: China Premier Li to meet New Zealand business leaders amid trade boost
